Package io.github.jorgericovivas.rust_essentials.diagnostic

Class DiagnosedException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
io.github.jorgericovivas.rust_essentials.diagnostic.DiagnosedException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DiagnosedException extends Exception implements Serializable
An Exception with a Diagnostic attached to it.

When printing this exception, it also shows the Diagnostic's message as show in it's documentation (See Diagnostic).

Note: 'message' is renamed to 'concept'.
Rust's Diagnostic from the proc macro crate.

See Also:

    • withHelp

      @NotNull public @NotNull DiagnosedException withHelp(@Nullable @Nullable String helpMessage)
      Adds a new message with information on how to solve the problem that happened.

      This will show up, along other help messages, when turning this diagnostic into a String.

    • commonGetMessage

      @NotNull public static @NotNull String commonGetMessage(@NotNull @NotNull Exception sourceException, @NotNull @NotNull Diagnostic diagnostic)
      Creates a message out of the Diagnostic, prepending and postpending it with two line separators.

      If the source exception doesn't have an empty stack trace, it postpends the message with a string telling:

      'If you can't solve this problem, show this information to the developers along this:'

      Parameters:
      sourceException - The source exception that might or not have a stack trace.
      diagnostic - The diagnostic this message gets built from.
      Returns:
      A message out of the Diagnostic, prepending and postpending it with two line separators, with a special message telling whether the source exception has a backtrace or not.
